On Thu, 18 Sep 2003 21:19:41 +0100 (BST), "Jim Dixon" <jdd@...>
said:
> 
> > Make an assertion instead.
> 
> Usually.  But sometimes what you want is a soft assertion -- if the
> condition doesn't hold, let me know, but keep on going.  And JUnit
> doesn't support that approach.

In unit tests you don't.  If that were the case I would never want to use
the object because it isn't stable.

In functional or integration tests, perhaps -- doubtful, but perhaps.  If
you do need a "soft assert" just surround it with a try/catch on
AssertionFailedError and keep going.

Hope that helps.

--
=jason
